III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Title
Rule Code & (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Section statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
Description (c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 02/12/2024, a youth truanted from secure facility by scaling a
basketball fence. Line of sight was maintained, and police were
contacted. Youth was returned within 8 minutes.
Investigation Complainant
I spoke with Complainant on 02/15/2024. Complainant did not
have additional information.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A at Havenwyck Impulse Disorder program on
02/15/2024. Youth A stated he was frustrated about not catching
and passing the football and this caused his refusal to line up with
the other youths to head back into the facility. Youth A stated he
decided to leave (truant) when he realized on his own that he
would receive a consequence for not lining up. Youth A stated he
walked to a corner of the basketball court and surprised himself
that he was able to use the pole, the fence, and fence connector
pieces to climb over. Youth A stated Staff Person 1 verbally
redirected him to get down from the fence. Youth A stated he
climbed over the fence and walked toward the next building. Youth
A stated he did not look back but knew Supervisor 1 followed him
and verbally redirected him to return to the facility. Youth A stated
law enforcement arrived, and he was transported back to the
facility.
Youth B and Youth C
I interviewed Youth B and Youth C at Havenwyck Impulse
Disorder Program on 02/15/2024. Youth B and Youth C stated
Youth A was upset about passing the football but did not express
plans about truanting. Youth B and Youth C stated they did not
witness Youth A leaving the fenced basketball court.
Staff Person 1
2

I interviewed Staff Person 1 at Havenwyck Impulse Disorder
Program on 02/15/2024. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A was upset
and refused to enter the facility from the fenced basketball court.
Staff Person 1 stated another staff took the other youths inside
and she took Youth B and Youth C into the facility when
Supervisor 1 arrived at the door. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A
was halfway up the fence when she switched positions with
Supervisor 1. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A did not respond to
redirection to not climb the fence and enter the facility.
Supervisor 1
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at Havenwyck Impulse Disorder
Program on 02/15/2024. Supervisor 1 stated she just clocked in to
work and received a call about Youth A refusing to enter the
facility from the fenced basketball court. Supervisor 1 stated Staff
Person 1 entered the facility with Youth B and Youth C when
Supervisor 1 approached the door to the outside basketball court.
Supervisor 1 stated she saw Youth A climb the fence and
immediately notified the house supervisor (Nurse 1) of elopement
and to call for law enforcement. Supervisor 1 stated she followed
Youth A to the building next to Havenwyck Impulse Disorder
Program. Supervisor 1 stated law enforcement arrived and
transported Youth A back to the facility without issue.
Chief Administrator
I spoke with Chief Administrator on 02/15/2024. Chief
Administrator stated the fence is a moveable chain link, which is
not supposed to allow climbing.
Video
02/12/2024 video footage of the fenced basketball court was
reviewed. 2:24 PM Youths line up and walk into the facility. 2:25
PM Staff Person 1 remains outside, facing Youth A. Youth A walks
up to one of the fenced basketball court corners. 2:29 PM Youth A
climbs the fence post, hoists himself up twice, and is over the
fence. Youth A walks towards a building on the same side of the
street as Havenwyck Impulse Disorder Program.
Documentation
Incident report dated 02/12/2024 at 2:29 PM written by Nurse 1
matches the interviews in this investigation.
Tour
Basketball court is fenced on three sides. The unfenced side is the
side of the facility. I observed the corner pole that Youth A used to
climb over the fence. The corner pole has multiple metal
3

connectors (like c-clamps) securing the moveable chain link fence
to the pole. In between the metal connectors are areas where the
moveable chain link fence is not attached or flush to the pole.
Analysis Youth A climbed over Havenwyck Impulse Disorder Program’s
moveable chain link fence surrounding the outdoor basketball
court as Staff Person 1 redirected Youth A to not climb the fence.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Havenwyck Impulse Disorder Program is to contact a fencing
company to determine how the fence can be improved to prevent
the ability to climb over it.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
